channel.title: Posts on Bujinkan North London
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Bujinkan North London

item.title: Training 27th February 2020
item.description: Good training today! We dug into tai sabaki and moving in Kamae. Drills are a great way to practice these aspects of training.

item.title: Training 19th February 2020
item.description: This time we looked at a few different variations on two wrist locks (Omote and Ura Gyaku). Depending on how the attack occurs, different approaches need to be considered. We also worked on how to use our footwork to maintain the appropriate distance to keep ourselves safe. Good training!

item.title: Training 12th February 2020
item.description: During this training we covered how different distances affect the timing used in a technique. We played around with a few different types of footwork (taisabaki) to achieve our goals. Fun times!

item.title: Training 29th January 2020
item.description: Last training we did some Muto Dori to get a feel for the added distance a weapon creates. We also looked at how we can put together different techniques and flow between them.

item.title: Training 22nd January 2020
item.description: We covered omote and ura gyaku from a variety of different distances as well as some Ninpo Taijutsu: the feeling of being caught and then escaping.

item.title: New Year 2020
item.description: Good start to the year on Wednesday. As usual, after all the mince pies, we started with the fundamentals: Kamae (shizen, ichimonji, jumonji, hicho) Ukemi (zenpo, koho and yoko kaiten) Sanshin/Gogyo no kata (chi, sui, ka, fu ku no kata) Kihon Happo (omote and ura gyaku) Really fun class!

item.title: Hyper Japan
item.description: The dojo did a demonstration at Hyper Japan.
